channel.title: Control Transfer Failed -9
channel.description:
I'm building a step sequencer patch, using the [Akai MIDImix](http://www.akaipro.com/products/recording/midimix) as a controller on the USB host port. Everything worked fine so far, but now I'm getting a "Control Transfer Failed -9" error when adding new midi/in/cc objects to my patch and then turning the according knobs on the controller when the patch is live. I'm already using a little over 40 midi/in/cc objects in the patch, but the MIDImix controller has a bunch more knobs and buttons which I'd like to use. Is there a limit on the amount of midi/in/cc objects one can have in a patch?
Here's my version information:
> Axoloti version : 1.0.12-1-0-g4de2b632 build time : 08/02/2017 00:15:42 GMT Link to firmware CRC E95BAC96 Status: factory (1.0.12,anon) : OK ( 1.0.12,clean ) Status : home : OK Status: community (1.0.12,anon) : OK ( 1.0.12,clean ) USB device found connected Authentic Axoloti Core search path : /Users/admin/Documents/axoloti/axoloti-factory/objects Firmware version: 1.0.0.1, crc=0xE95BAC96, entrypoint=0x20011000 search path : /Users/admin/Documents/axoloti/objects search path : /Users/admin/Documents/axoloti/axoloti-contrib/objects finished loading objects

item.title: Control Transfer Failed -9
item.dc:creator: @NightMachines The Tuesday Night Machines
item.description:
@NightMachines wrote:

D'oh! Totally forgot about those settings! Sorry!

Read full topic

item.title: Control Transfer Failed -9
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

The number of mod sources is defined in the patch settings.

Read full topic

item.title: Control Transfer Failed -9
item.dc:creator: @NightMachines The Tuesday Night Machines
item.description:
@NightMachines wrote:

After further testing, I think it's related to modsource objects. As soon as I attach a new modsource to a midi/in/cc object, the error occurs.

Read full topic
